Course Outcomes.CO1: Students will be able to analyze the main challenges and opportunities of social robots.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students (individually and in groups) will develop the ability to analyze the need of the social robots in different scenarios.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students will be able to predict the possible consequences of social interaction between the human and the robots. Students will also be able to offer their own set of ELS rules for the development of the social robot.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to Social Robotics, How is it different from traditional robotics and its applications

Social Robots Skill Set - To understand humans (Social Emotional Intelligence and Socio-Cognitive Skills)
Social Robots and Communication Skills - To be able to interact with humans
